website_summaries.verdict: A three-pack that seems like a good deal, but choose this only if color variety is your main concern.
pros: Sturdily built fabric collars with strong clasps
Multiple color choices for homes with 2-3 cats
cons: Reflective strip develops cracks and rubs off after a few months
Some owners feel the collar is thin
Plastic bell doesn’t ring very loudly
Too small for cats over 15 lbs

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best breakaway collars I've found yet! The cat that adopted us (and is pretty much an outside cat due to that being his natural state) is a bush ninja and every collar we tried on him went missing within a day. However, this collar has prevailed! He still has it on! It's been months. We finally trusted the collar enough to put his ID tags on it. The reflective part of the collar is nice, but I don't see it being obvious enough to people driving/etc. It's a pretty sturdy, fabric collar although fraying/etc is definitely to be expected if your cat goes outdoors. Fantastic buy. If we ever go through the three provided, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Francis

customer_reviews.title: Really like the collars
customer_reviews.text: Really like the collars. I have 4 cats. They are both inside and out. They always seem to get their collars snagged. Thankfully these are break away. My calico recently got hers caught on a limb. It broke away I'm assuming like it was supposed to. She wasn't injured at all. And I went outside with a flashlight. The reflective collar was glowing about 50 yards from my house caught on a limb. It didn't choke her/hang her "my worst fear" and a added bonus I found the collar because of its high reflection with literally 0 effort. Will purchase more to keep on hand for the future. Very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin V.

customer_reviews.title: They give way too easy, so if they get outside and are pretty ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and reflective wears off in less then a week. Given if your cat doesn't rub against anything or doesn't play with their collar it might last a month or two. The break-away design is just okay. They give way too easy, so if they get outside and are pretty agile (climbing trees etc.) the collar will fall off and there goes your ID and possibly your pet. The collar's were so frayed after a week I didn't want to send them back, so i went to my local pet store and bought some for $7 Each.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Visual is misleading and hiding major defect
customer_reviews.text: You can't see it in any of their photos, but the bell on these collars is attached by a very cheap, flexible piece of metal. I have four cats and the first one that I put a collar on pulled the bell off and I only hope she didn't swallow it. If the bell was attached as it seems to be in the photos of the product, it would be fine. The bell hangs down twice as long as it should. I will have to try another company because I don't trust their visuals any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Outstandingly BAD collars
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the high rating on these collars. I purchased 3 sets. Within 4 days I was down 3 collars and tags. After 7 days 2 more cats were missing their collar and tags. Breakaway should not mean fall off if cat scratches his/her neck. Maybe these should be labeled "For decorative use only. Use only on indoor declawed cats." I'm going back to elastic buckle collars. They may fray but at least they stay on the cat.
customer_reviews.author: Bless-the-beasts

customer_reviews.title: Breakaway clasps don't last with normal use and bells break off
customer_reviews.text: I ordered again but still questionable quality. Now th3 bells break off. Two of the three collars in this pack are already gone. The breakaway does not hold them tight enough and they drop off of our indoor kitties when they're just walking through the house. Unfortunately one of the collars dropped off and we cannot find it and it had all of our kittens tags on it. So that's an additional cost for us to reorder. I tried to contact seller did not hear back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: If reflective feature is what you look for, keep on looking
customer_reviews.text: Reflective stripe came off within the first 2 days of the 3 collars we've used. My cat lost the first collar, so I know the breakaway feature works. That had lost the reflective stripe. So we put the second collar on and the reflective stripe came off so we changed the collar after it came off. The third collar also had the strip hanging from one corner so we cut it off bc it was dragging. She's been using the third collar for months now, but without the reflective part. I'm not sure what's the durability on the bell since I always take that off to allow her to hunt, since she spends most of the day outdoors
customer_reviews.author: cecilia so-chae

customer_reviews.title: OK but not great for long term use with active cats......
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my two cats. They came great but less than 6 months later the reflective strip is gone on both and today the plastic that holds the clip broke on my kittens collar. My kitten plays pretty hard but I still think that it shouldn't have just snapped. Also the #1 thing they advertise (reflective strip) should have faded already! My older cat just sits around all day and hers is still faded but it still works. You do get 3 so for the price it's a good deal but don't expect to get a long use out of it unless you have a older/less active cat.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping in bed

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Receieved Wednesday night. Has been on my cat for less than 48 hours, as it’s now Friday morning. See pictures of reflective material which is already peeling and missing from majority of poor quality strip.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not sure.
customer_reviews.text: The world of breakaway collars for cats..... some don't breakaway, some do too easily. Without getting into the debate of indoor versus outdoor cats, I have a former street cat who needs his outside time. I bought this collar to use with the "Birds Be Safe" collar, aka the cat world version of the scarlet letter for his crimes against wildlife. We've gone through 2 collars in 3 months. His previous collar (different brand) lasted 10 months. This could be because of the Birds Be Safe collar gives our other cats something to claw into during WCWF (World Cat Wrestling Federation) matches, or because of the collar itself.
customer_reviews.author: jen

customer_reviews.title: Collar tightened on it's own almost chocked cat
customer_reviews.text: I put one of the collars on my cat and made sure there were at least a fingers width of room between the collar and her neck. She remained in our garage over night. The next morning I found her collar so tight and maladjusted that I could not fit ANY fingers under it. It appeared to be chocking her. The collar had somehow slipped tighter, but would not loosen while on her neck (or even easily done after off the neck). I immediately attempted to remove, but even this was not easy to do. I was able to pop it off by pulling apart, but being able to grasp it while so tight was not easily done.
customer_reviews.author: DurangoMom

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: These are moderately well made. I have small, light cats (4.5-8 pounds) so I shaved the breakaway clips down a little so they'd open easier. I also cut the ears off the clips as per other reviewers saying they dug into their cat's necks. They've worked okay if they're worn snug, they can be made small enough for my tiny cats. Cats will still get a claw into them and yank them off, and one cat's shredded a collar by clawing at it. Good thing these come in packs.
customer_reviews.author: AmyG

customer_reviews.title: Safe collars
customer_reviews.text: These collars are very reflective and good quality. Super nice colors. My cats are inside/outside and these collars really help with finding them at night to come in. The little bells can be heard from a distance and the reflective strip can be seen far away when using a flashlight. My cats loose these collars every once in while which is good because they are not caught up on something. I like buying these cute collars in numbers because of that.
customer_reviews.author: Torina N.

customer_reviews.title: Reflective strip falls off!! Not worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the collars for less than a month and the reflective strip on them has already come off of them! I am not happy at all with this product. When I purchase something that says it is a reflective collar I expect the reflective portion to at least last longer then a week!! I do not recommend this product at all if you are buying for the reflective reason which is what I had wanted. Now as an overall collar, the bells have also fallen off of 2 of them, so overall this is a very cheaply made product.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: keeping my fingers crossed
customer_reviews.text: so far they are holding up - i have 2 young brothers who are indoor/outdoor and like to wrestle so they have lost several collars and so far these seem to be holding out - the snap doesn't come apart as easily as some of the others have and i like that. it seems like they will have to put a bit more effort into breaking out of these which i'd rather have, since i'm tired of spending so much money on collars. I only gave this a 4 star instead of a 5 because the collar itself is very thin, but not terrible. i will purchase again if they stay on for at least a month!
customer_reviews.author: keebieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Tiny little info capsule!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Very impressed. The collars are break away, but your pet would really have to be in trouble. In other words, they aren't easily separated, but I feel confident that they will break away should my cat need to. Get this: they came with a tiny little capable that screws apart with a little scroll inside on which you can write your/your pet's info. Place this in the collar. Neato mosquito! Absolutely worth the price for three. Very bright stripe. To my taste, I wish they were a little thicker, er, "wider" I guess. Just because the colors look so pretty against my cat's fur. If you're on the fence, get these.
customer_reviews.author: sarah Ellen Thomas

customer_reviews.title: VERY GOOD PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: These collars arrived on time with no issues. The collars are of good quality better than the one I bought at Petsmart. The tags and bells are removable and they are highly visible at night in car headlights which is why I put collars on at all. Of my 10 cats so far only 1 has consistently managed to lose his collar and that cat has a small head and a skinny long neck allowing it to slip over his head. The break away point is not to sensitive but if caught on something it does open. The closures are cute little cat heads. I will purchase again when they lose them all to help keep them safe on street.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat managed to bite it off from his neck ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat managed to bite it off from his neck the first night. At first I thought it was the buckle that was low quality, but my professor told me afterwards that it was intended that way to prevent cats struggling and choking themselves when it got hooked on something else. Then it was the bell to blame. Originally the bell was connected by two rings to the collar and it was long enough for my cat to bite and drag the collar off by. So I removed one ring and my cat could never do that again. Another perk is that you can write with a marker pen your phone on the reflective band.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Not securely fastened
customer_reviews.text: These collars are beautiful but they do not stay on my cats! I've had cats for 60+ years and have bought collars for my cats just as long. I bought these collars because I have two cats who like to escape the house and I want to be able to see them in the dark using their collars. I've had the collars for just a short time and it seems that the cats lose them about once a week. Unacceptable. Will be sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: Yankeegirl86

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value for my cat that looses his collar outside somewhere
customer_reviews.text: I first liked the value, 3 name tags personalized for the price of 1 at my pet store. Also liked that I could put 3 lines all on one side. The promptness that my order was received, during the pandemic was so speedy, less than a week, outstanding. I also got a personal thank you note, real handwriting...and this is a small family owned business, which I also say we should all use and keep in business, as my family also had a small family business... I wish my cat didn't keep loosing his collar and name tag, but at least now I am ready and can affordable do so. Thank you Ken.
customer_reviews.author: Norleen

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: While I only really wanted two, this was a better value for the money. I just saved the remaining collars in the event either of the two get lost or broken. I found these easy to adjust and I wanted them to be lightweight and comfortable for the cats. The collars that these replaced had glitter and rough edges on the plastic connection. These new ones are smooth and don't have any points on the inner collar that might cause discomfort to the cats. My cats are indoors, so I don't really need the reflective tape, but I like knowing it's there just in case. The collar material is soft, flexible and nice, bright colors.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Bigbee

customer_reviews.title: Reflective strip wearing off
customer_reviews.text: I do like the safety release feature of this collar but I can buy those at the nearest big box store. I bought these specifically for the reflective strip on the collar. The strip is already wearing off and I've had them about 5 weeks. I do not recommend this collar or any like them with this style of reflective strip. It's much like a screen printed film on the collar and it rubs off easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Mixed review
customer_reviews.text: YOU NEED A VIDEO ON HOW TO UNHOOK IT!! WHY DONT YOU HAVE ONE??? IT'S HARD AS HECK TO OPEN. Confusing, too!!! YOUR INSTRUCTIONS STINK. Not Only are they Printed in dark beige, too light to see .... it's Also such A SMALL FONT (Print size), I CAN'T READ IT WITHOUT A MAGNIFYING GLASS. We older folks have older eyes, and cant see teensy small print! And most of us have pets. Otherwise, the size & thickness is good for my cats, and reflective strip holds up well (8 mos., so far) !!!! PLEASE POST VIDEO ON HOW TO OPEN & CLOSE THE CLASP !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie G.

customer_reviews.title: Great collars
customer_reviews.text: I needed collars for my cats who come and go as they please (we have a cat door and a doggie door they use). These collars are great. I saw other reviews about the cat ears on the collars being a problem, and I agree they would be if you do not remove them. I did that easily with a pair of nail clippers. I just clipped the ears on the collars off real easily and checked to make sure there were no sharp points. 3 our of my 5 cats have helped each other remove their collars. 2 still have their collars on. But for the price, that's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure how long these dollars will last as they are a cheap nylon material. They should be advertised as a small dog collar only, not a cat collar as they barely fit my cats after tightening them fully. Also, the picture looks like a teal color which is what I wanted but I received a navy blue which was disappointing. Lastly, these were very hard to pull apart for something that is advertised as a breakaway collar. UPDATE: These collars do not last long at all. I have indoor cats and their collars are fraying already. Buy something else, don't waste the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bargain!
customer_reviews.text: These collars will work out fine for my three indoor-outdoor kitties. They all have them on and have not lost one yet. The plastic ears on the cat's head on the buckle are sharp so these might irritate a short-haired kitty. I read in other reviews that someone actually clipped off the ears. My cats are all medium to long-haired and it has not bothered them. They fit adult cats with no issue and the reflective stripe can be seen when light hits it. They have a bell but the bell does not tingle very loud. I would definitely purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: I gave it a try!
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying a few breakaway color for my 1 yr old cat. He somehow managed to take them all off and the dog got a hold of it and ate the bells (yeah, great...). This purchase was my last effort trying out another breakaway collars... It has been 5 days and the cat still has it on his neck... It seems like it's working so far and the cat likes it. The bell is still there too..! Glad I bought it! Now I can locate my cat alot easier with the bell and reflective collar at night! Update: after 3 weeks on, the reflective part is starting to peel off. That sucks... Reduced the 5 stars to 3.
customer_reviews.author: Jaksie

customer_reviews.title: CAT COLLARS<TOO?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 12 collars total! 7 broke and the 5 I have on my cats are just shredded. Terrible Company!! DO NOT HAVE ANY CONTACT NUMBERS BUT WANTS YOU TO FILE FOR WARRANTY!! NOWHERE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Donna L. Protti

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, pointy clasps!
customer_reviews.text: Product was pretty much what I expected for this price. One major flaw is that the decorative cat-head clasp has sharp, pointy ears that stick right up into your kitty's throat! Very uncomfortable for your furry friend. We had to file down the ears on our collars before putting them on our cats. Collars will not fit kittens or small cats.
customer_reviews.author: clp866

customer_reviews.title: Great product, nice quantity & great price!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value for the money. I know this in particular since my 1 cat has lost 3 of the collars already! I gotta say having the bell alone makes these collars worth buying...(the bell makes me laugh!) I have 3 cats, all different ages, and you can tell which one is coming in the room by the sound/speed of the bell tinkling!! But, the reflective strip does work & has been a blessing, as well as the safety detachment...annoying as it is to replace a collar, better that than my much loved cat. I’ll be buying another set of these..great product, nice price!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Curtis

customer_reviews.title: I love these great quality especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered a million collars from amazon and these are the most high quality durable collars I have found! The ears on the kitty cat clasp are very small even smaller than they appear in photos and are not a problem whatsoever. I really like these great purchase especially for the price! Yes they are break away and they are not too easily broken away however the full weight of the animal being caught on something should definitely break away with no problem but should not have issues with the breakaway clasp being too easily broken away though
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Ummm not that great.
customer_reviews.text: I suppose you do get what you pay for. I have 4 cats total. 2 of my cats regularly pop these collars off. One of them somehow managed to get just the bell off. They fray very easily & seem to pull the cats hair as all of them scratch at them. As I said though my cats are indoor cats. The one who goes outside has a collar from Walmart. Shes had it on since before I ordered these. Has yet to pop it off. Oddly enough she is usually the one cat I have that never keeps a collar. So no, I really cant record these. Of the 6 in the pack I've already tossed 3.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: Love these reflective cat collars
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats and shopping for collars can get quite expensive. These collars came in a set of 3 for such a great price, I just couldn't pass up that deal. We have several other cats in the neighborhood that look similar to mine, so I love that I can spot my cats out amongst the rest. We do have a stray dog from time to time, so I like the snap apart safety feature in the instance they get stuck and need to get away. The band is very comfortable and easily adjusts. The best part is that the clasp is the shape of a cats face! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges injured my cat.
customer_reviews.text: For an adjustable collar, these are quite small. They don't get much over 9". We out this on our enormous cat, and could fit 3 fingers under the collar, but the cat shaped clasp (with sharp pointy ears) and rough plastic parts left a 1" round wound on our cat's neck after 2 days. These are awful.
customer_reviews.author: David & Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Buy literally anything else.
customer_reviews.text: My kittens each wore theirs for about a week before the collars were completely destroyed. They came apart so easily and the “breakaway” function allowed the collars to fall right off effortlessly, so my cats took them off and hid them places. I wouldn’t recommend. I bought this set because we have 5 kittens running around our house and All of them look alike. The collars were supposed to help us tell them apart, but we gave up because they wouldn’t stay on the cats and after a week they were so tattered and torn that we had to throw them away. Super disappointed. Pictures of one of the collars for attention.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Good, inexpensive collars.
customer_reviews.text: We have several outdoor cats and property, so they are frequently losing their collars. I bought these because I liked the bright colors and the price. They are very good collars. Due to the low price, it doesn't bother me if a cat loses one. I just put another one on. I don't like the cat ears on the plastic clasp. They are VERY pointy and I feel like they poke into the cats' necks. I clip off the points with heavy duty kitchen scissors and file down the rough edges with a emery board.
customer_reviews.author: AMP

customer_reviews.title: REALLY nice collars for cats!
customer_reviews.text: Got this new set of reflective collars for my 4 house cats (they range in weight from about 7 lbs to about 18 lbs) and they're perfect for them! They're not so wide that they irritate the cats, and the reflective stuff on them is holding up really well. They also have a nice D ring on them to attach bells and tags... They're breakaway, but they don't breakaway overly easily (this was a problem with the last collars I had on them, they disappeared if the wind blew on them too hard).
customer_reviews.author: HezziiTop Contributor: Crochet

customer_reviews.title: 100% recommend. Perfect for litters and/or fosters.
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT collars, especially for the price. I got them specifically for the kittens that I foster and adopt out, and they work wonders. I did put one on a chihuahua puppy just to check its durability, to my pleasant surprise, it is holding up to the rough and tumble lifestyle of a puppy and her sister, the only thing I can note is the reflective strip does come off over time, however, this only happened on the one on the puppy, not the one I have put on the kitten yet. Not a deal breaker at all, just worth noting. Definitely will buy again, but the 12 pack next time.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Womack

customer_reviews.title: Decent collars for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my cat and overall they're nice looking. However, the reflective tape began to peel off on his collar after 2-3 months ish which I guess is okay although I wish it would've lasted longer. The colors themselves are a very bright color to begin with so they do aid our outside cat in being visible at night. The bell was annoying but was easily taken off with no problem. The safety release clip is useful so in case the collar gets stuck on something it snaps and the cat can get out from wherever he is which is very assuring.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted2Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with the ears!
customer_reviews.text: The plastic ears are pointy. The price is fine. And they come with bells. Omg do they come with bells! I cut the points off the ears with wire cutters. Better now. No bell. Adios. My little man not digging it, but he’s going to wear collars with his tag that says he has diabetes. He’s indoor outdoor. I’ve never felt a need to put a collar on him. But due to this medical condition, I need him home for shots and dinner now. Aside from that! He’ll rock pink purple blue green red..... until he learns it is safety collar. Haha.
customer_reviews.author: pandaty

customer_reviews.title: Know who you're dealing with
customer_reviews.text: When you cat has 6 solid black kittens and need to tell them apart... these are perfect! No more guessing who's crawled into the bag of cat food, feasting away.... no more guessing who's knocking my drinks over, I know exactly who to watch out for and who can be trusted around my cups. They also pop right off if your cat gets caught under the bed or between a tight spot so they don't choke on the collar. I've found them littered around in various places where they could have met their doom, but were saved with the easy detached snapper thing on the collars. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Thought our cats would not tolerate these as they are outdoor and very independent. However, the collars stay on and so far do not seem to bother them. The only downside is the bell is so quiet it almost defeats the purpose of alerting wildlife to their presence, which is the sole reason for getting the collars. I might try another bell as the collars themselves are perfect. Unlike others, I have not had any issues with the pointy ears on the breakaway clasp.
customer_reviews.author: tesla

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Update 7/2019: The Upgraded Version - Reflective Cat Collar with Bell does not hold up. Not only the reflector coat peel off, but the fabric becomes frayed even on an older, less active indoor cat. He is on his second one out of the bunch and it looks like trash. The latch does stay secure, but due the other issues, I would look for a different collar. I put one on my indoor cat November 3rd, 2018 and the silver reflector is peeling off already. The fabric does not feel sturdy enough to last. It’s fine for what I need, but they are definitely poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: JG Lex KY

customer_reviews.title: Nope - did not hold up past a month
customer_reviews.text: I though this was a nice set of collars when I first received them. Approx. a month after I put it on him I was checking my cat to make sure it hadn't gotten too loose or too tight and noticed that the reflective strip had peeled off and the collar looked like it had gotten rolled around in rock hauler or something. In short, this is not a durable product. On the flip side my other cat has been wearing a Kong collar for 2 years and while it is faded it is still in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Molly P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent with the exception of pointy cat ears
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy product with great colors, easy adjustments and excellent reflective properties. My single problem with it—and indeed with what appears to be ALL of the cat collars I’ve quickly perused—is that the clasp on the collar is a cat face with pointy ears that can poke your cat’s neck. I had no difficulty in smoothing these down with a file, but it’s a pain to do. Again, these collars are not unique with this design, so It’d be a complaint with any of them.
customer_reviews.author: golli-1112

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: These don't hold up well. Sure they are cheaper than pet store collars... but when the cats scratch at them in the first few days of wear, they have strings of the fabric that start coming loose and hanging down.
customer_reviews.author: bluestang65

customer_reviews.title: Breaks far too easily!
customer_reviews.text: I understand the safety concept of breakaway collars, but in my opinion this product breaks away far too easily. The six-pack I ordered for my two indoor/outdoor cats is down to a single collar in about a month. They somehow keep ditching these collars continuously. I would buy these again only if the breakaway strength is improved. EDIT: As of 9/16/2020, ALL collars have gone missing. I understand the safety concept of breakaway collars, but these are way too weak.
customer_reviews.author: Mojoed

customer_reviews.title: Safe for cats and birds in the yard
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our 2 cats. The colors are bright. They are easy to put on. The bell sound is mild, but enough to warn the birds coming into our yard about the lurking danger. Very effective. It is also safe for the cats since it opens up when the strap gets caught in a tree branch. The cats do lose them once in a while when the strap gets caught somewhere and snaps open, but it is a small price to pay for the safety of our cats.
customer_reviews.author: V. Herbert

customer_reviews.title: Very good cat collars
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good cat collars, and the reflection works very well. I can see my cat's collar from across the yard at night with just the houselights shining through the window, about twenty or thirty feet away. The clasp works great and is easy to take off, so I don't worry about my cats getting stuck anywhere. I'm also not concerned that the collars are going to fall apart, they seem to be very good quality, and they are easy enough to adjust to the right size. I recommend these, they're pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: Mai

customer_reviews.title: GET THIS COLLAR!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got the 6 pack because my kitty always manages to lose her break-away collar within a day or two. These we're super affordable so i tried it and, i don't know how, but puddles is still wearing her first one! I definitely stick with break-away collars because i can't stand the thought of her getting caught on something and being stuck, but they usually break away too easily. I did test these to make sure she can get free and she can. These are just the best!
customer_reviews.author: KaitKat22

customer_reviews.title: Good, Inexpensive Breakaway Collars
customer_reviews.text: This is my third order. I last ordered them in November 2017. I have two indoor/outdoor cats who like to climb over the chain-link fence in my backyard. I insist on breakaway collars because I worry that they might get caught on the fence. Yes, the reflective strip wears off and the collars themselves become "fuzzy" from my cats scratching them, but at this price, I can afford to replace them on a regular basis. Update: I'm still ordering these collars regularly and am still happily recommending them if you have an "escape artist" cat line mine.
customer_reviews.author: Inquiring Mind

customer_reviews.title: Super affordable generic cat collars.
customer_reviews.text: These are like 1000% cheaper than collars you buy at Walmart or any pet stores. They are a little over a dollar per collar. When they get frayed or dirty after a few months, you don't have to feel bad about tossing them and replacing them with a new collar. They're cute, a bit generic, but durable and useful. The breakaway feature is nice, the collar is large enough for my ... eh hem ... rotund kitty, and the tiny bell can be taken off and thrown out if you prefer your cat not to hate you. I would definitely recommend, especially if you have more than one cat to put collars on.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Pohl

customer_reviews.title: Great colors
customer_reviews.text: My partner’s cat’s collar went missing. We got her these and they’re great. I love that there are so many different collars to choose from, all in great colors, so that we have backup collars for the future. It’s also great that these have a reflective strip, since she likes to go outside and is a dark-colored cat. The bell is also super helpful since she’s quite stealthy. The collars fit great and are easily adjustable, too.
customer_reviews.author: Haleigh

customer_reviews.title: They Definitely Work!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great thing these are sold as a six pack, because my cat has busted out of two of them already. Now, she probably broke free just by being a rowdy little kitten playing outside, but it feels good knowing that she definitely wouldn't be dangling from some branch or fence somewhere, choked by her collar. I might recommend getting your pets chipped when using these, since your tags are going to get lost with the collars.
customer_reviews.author: G. Dodge

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Great product. Would be amazing visibility if my cat didn’t have super long fluffy fur. Especially in the winter. And I know the break away clasp works because we’re alreay on our second collar (which was the purpose of getting a three pack). Our cat roams around close to the house (I believe) and still came back without the collar. So it does it’s job. Will be buying more once I’ve lost them all😂 Also, our other cat loves the bell so she can hear him coming.
customer_reviews.author: Two Moose Design

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitty Collars!!!
customer_reviews.text: Joey loves these collars and knows he cannot go outside without his on! I have bought this set twice! Super comfy. The clasp is tight, but he has lost a few! I’m glad he is safe... if they pop off, they need to! The silver stripe scrapes up a bit but still works great. I love the bright neon colors!! When he is out in daytime I want neighbors to know he is not a stray!!! These r great.
customer_reviews.author: M. OlsonTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: So far, quite satisfied with this collar
customer_reviews.text: Only just received this set of collars, so my cat has not worn one long; however, It appears to be and feels very sturdy, and the reflective band works well. The quick-release safety clip really clips snugly so it doesn't come apart simply from my cat scratching at it. Seems like good quality and quantity for the price. I'm giving it 5 stars now. Will have to update this review in a few weeks once she's worn it for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: cbb

customer_reviews.title: As advertised!
customer_reviews.text: What I wanted! A good collar that won't strangle my cat if he gets stuck and struggles enough, but also won't fall off. I had it too loose at first and he was able to get it off with his teeth, so I know it's possible. But he can't get his teeth in it now that I tightened it a bit. Bell works, and the collar is reflective. By the way, my cat is only an outdoor cat if I'm in the enclosed backyard with him. But he wears the collar every time he goes out, just in case he gets loose!
customer_reviews.author: Elle Michele

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: One of the best prices for getting mutliple collars. Can be adjusted to fit a kitten or adult cat. I have a 3month old kitten and a 12lb adult cat. My adult cat loses his collars in my yard sometimes so I like having spares, and the little bell helps me find the kitten when he's running around in the house playing hard to get. The reflective strip does wear off on some spots after about a month of use, but I'm still satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: We have a sweet little fella that just insists on going outside. He regularly goes through collars and is pretty picky about what collars he wears. He'll make it very obvious when a collar is not comfortable and will relentlessly scratch until we take it off. This collar is light weight, bright and most importantly SAFE. I would worry about kitty getting stuck on a fence by his collar and do not have this worry, thanks to the easy snap / unsnap.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Good value and quality
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! My cat loses his collar all the time. I use to buy each colllor for $5 this is way cheaper. Had a reflective stripe which helps for safety which is a nice feature. So far so good! Let's see if he can keep it a month before losing it.
customer_reviews.author: A fabulous shopperTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great and safe product for your cats
customer_reviews.text: I love the quick release safety feature, so I never have to worry about the cats being choked by their own collars. It’s also been 3-4 months since I bought them and none have fallen off. The reflective part is Very reflective and can be seen from quite a distance.
customer_reviews.author: RNPfrog

customer_reviews.title: Reflective Strip Peeling Off
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my two cats to hold their tags and provide a reflective surface for safety. They are adjustable and after several weeks both are still wearing their collars (they tend to lose their collars). My one problem is with the reflective strips. They are peeling off and my cats have only been wearing them for about three weeks. The collars are OK but if you are looking for a reflective collar I cannot recommend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl R.

customer_reviews.title: Great value-but sharp points on ears of cat clasp that must be rounded
customer_reviews.text: These collars are a great value. They are reflective, have a bell and stay clasped without being to difficult to breakthrough. I was hesitant to purchase these being afraid they would be junk at this price; however I am very glad I did as these collars are great and have far exceeded my expectations. Update to this review-these collars have a cat head design for the clasp, and the ears are VERY SHARP. We have used a metal file to round them out, and they are now fine. However, they are TOO SHARP for cats to wear as is. Please correct this problem!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ambia

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the price fool you
customer_reviews.text: I needed breakaway collars for my outdoor cats. I came across these and thought the price was way too low to be any good. I have 4 cats. I decided I could return them or keep them since they are so affordable. I'm so glad I ordered them! They are definitely break away and their reflective strip makes me feel they are safer at night. In fact, the cats reflective strip gives them away when they are being stubborn about coming back inside at dark. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Green

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitty Collars
customer_reviews.text: Love these collars. The kitties love them too, because now, there’s no sneaking up on each other! Each collar has a bell and a breakaway safety clasp so kitty can be heard, and won’t become trapped if the collar gets caught on something. Adjustable size and nice selection of colors. I put some extra collars out as toys and on a play basket to introduce them, then slipped them on with the distraction of treats.
customer_reviews.author: PattiKS

customer_reviews.title: Great collar. Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: These are breakaway collars so your cat doesn't get caught on the branch of a bush. If she pulls hard enough, the collar comes off and she can get free. She loses about 3 or 4 collars a year. That's why it's great that they sell them in a multi-pack for so cheap. The reflective strip also works great at night. The bell is good too, but I take it off the collar. It makes it harder for Kitty to kill rats if they can hear her stalking them. This is a great collar at a great value.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Homan

customer_reviews.title: Good collars
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I have 8 cats. I wanted a good collar that would come off if they got stuck on something Really anything to keep my babies safe from danger that having a collar or not having a collar could bring, these are a great value for your money, although if your cat scratches at it they get all fuzzy and weird. Now, most of my cats lost theirs but that's most likely my fault I put them on quite loose because I didn't want them to get hung up on a fence or something. One of my cats actually still has his to this day and I bought the collars in december! #ProudCatMomMoment
customer_reviews.author: Natalie ann

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, durable, reflective, not fancy
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple cats, and I like the reflective feature of these colors. They are inexpensive, but they are fine for common every day use. My cat rarely lose them, and I usually throw them away because they’re worn looking, not necessarily nonfunctional. I especially liked that they used a tiny key ring type attachment to affix the bells to the collars, so I could easily remove them if I didn’t want them on there. Not fancy, but perfect for basic use, even on indoor-outdoor cats.
customer_reviews.author: theg5y

customer_reviews.title: BE VERY CAREFUL WITH THESE COLLARS!
customer_reviews.text: I would be extremely careful with these collars. Just had them delivered this morning. Sized them for each cat and the smaller cat somehow got her lower jaw caught underneath the collar and was stuck with the collar wrapped in her mouth. After getting clawed a lot, I got the collar off her. Both cats yanked the collars off there latches which left me chasing 2 cats around the yard. Needless to say, the collars are now in the garbage. BE CAREFUL with these collars. Had this happened at night, I'd have a severely injured cat
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Davis

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This three pack was pretty inexpensive so I gave them a shot. I should have gone with something else. I am disappointed to say that the reflective quality didn't last for more than a couple of months. After a while, it started to peel right off. The last pet collar I purchased with reflective qualities lasted for almost 2 years. Now I know. Better to pay a little bit more for something that will last a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: Christmasinjuly

customer_reviews.title: Just Ok
customer_reviews.text: I'm so so about these. Very cheap pricewise, but the bell makes almost no noise. Some jingle when the kitty is running. None when it's stalking. But..ok, I can just add jingle bells to it. The collars themselves are study. The release catch is a bit tighter than I'd like even after many pulls by me hoping it would ease up. For $6 bucks...sure, little throw away kitty collars that need better bells.
customer_reviews.author: corey

customer_reviews.title: cat is happy to wear collar
customer_reviews.text: our cat Delilah disappeared for 7 almost 8 weeks from late November. she is home now. we ordered a tracing device through Amazon and was offered the chance to buy Delilah a new collar at the same time. we are glad we did. the three collars and tracking device arrived and we set cat up with new collar quickly and easily. she has not fussed with it (she has worn collar since she first arrived in our house years ago.) now we either have to get two more cats or just keep the spare collars. thanks for great product.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!  Bright Colors & Reflective Stripe
customer_reviews.text: I love the reflective stripe around these collars -can be seen very well with even a flashlight in the yard. The orange is even brighter in person -more of a hunters orange, which is great! The break-a-way clasp is the same as other collars at Walmart or other pet stores. The price cannot be beaten!!! You would pay $5 or more for one of these collars at any other store! I know... I checked. So to get 3 for $5 is a great buy. Hey, and even if you only need one collar, then donate the extras to your local adoption center :) Win, Win! You won't be disappointed with these collars. Meow!
customer_reviews.author: Nurse&MomOF4

customer_reviews.title: These do NOT release!!! Don't buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Well- made collar but BEWARE: it does NOT release like it should!! My poor cat got her collar caught on a metal fence and the collar TWISTED around her neck and did NOT release! Thank God I saw it happen and was able to save her! I immediately threw the collars away! Very dangerous and life- threatening!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Forest

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this deal. I was hesitant but the price was right. They are much higher quality than previous collars bought at feed stores and pet stores, for a fraction of the price. The breakaway is a little stiff for my kitten, but if you open and close them a bunch you can loosen it up. The bright neon colors warn the birds and the reflective strip will help me see her, if I ever decide to let her out at night.
customer_reviews.author: KayRas

customer_reviews.title: cheap
customer_reviews.text: Reflective strip was gone from all 6 collars within 1 week. All 3 of our cats are outside cats and reflective material had come off the 1st week and 3 collars came off and weren't found. Save your money and buy a better collar.
customer_reviews.author: David Benz

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect!
customer_reviews.text: The price for all of these was amazing, great deal. There was a little issue with the little tiny sharp cat ears on the tops but they were super easy to clip right of the clasp with regular scissors before I put them on the kitties. I'd also check for any rough spots on the inside, a few had to be sanded a tiny bit in order to make sure they weren't rubbing the kitties raw or anything. My Xavia loves her little purple collar. (As pictured, yawning.)
customer_reviews.author: Angela Berry

customer_reviews.title: Cat Collars
customer_reviews.text: Really nice set of collars. Purchased for my four cats who need bells so we know where they are! Nice quality and colors. Have held up well for the last couple months. Buckles well and has breakaway buckle in case kitty gets stuck on something. We have a wide range of cats from smaller young cats to a big Maine Coon cat and these worked for all of them with great and easy adjustable slides.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherBTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Reflective strip wore off in a month
customer_reviews.text: Collar itself is minimal but acceptable. The clasp generally stays attached during Mr Kitty's all night neighborhood adventures. Although he has come home without his collar twice in last 2 months. The bell is great to hear him pouncing up the stairs, and will hopefully prevent him catching birds in the spring. BUT... the reflective strip has almost completely rubbed off in less than a month. Useless feature. This is important for Mr Kitty's late night romps. Update: Mr Kitty lost 3rd collar. I reluctantly bought again. I guess average $3 month on new collar is not that unbearable. But I'm certainly not enthusiastic about the product.
customer_reviews.author: lliam

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: 2 of my cats already lost their collar. I made sure it was tight enough to not come off but loose enough to not hurt them. My cats are both inside and outside cats but they stay around the house they dont go anywhere most of the time. but 2 of them lost their collar after 2 days of use. Like I need them to stay on in case they run away otherwise what's the point. Now I need to buy new collars and tags because the cats lost them so easily
customer_reviews.author: Lizet

customer_reviews.title: Very reflective! Good product!
customer_reviews.text: These are very attractive, very reflective collars. My cats are clearly visible if any light hits them in the dark, and the collars breakaway if they get stuck. However, if your cat(s) does not like collars,l and breaks out of them, don’t buy this product. The clip is only medium strength. Buy something stronger, like a Rogz breakaway collar. One of my cats hates collars and always pulls them off. This one one is no exception. The only collars that stay on him are the Rogz brand breakaway collars.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Reflective and breakaway
customer_reviews.text: These are really reflective. I like the look of the latch, it is in the shape of a kitty. However, I am concerned about the latch's durability. Definitely will break away if cat gets caught but feels like it will come undone over time. Guess time will tell. Find the value, 6 for 8 dollars or $1.33 a piece a bargain. The material feels sturdy and as noted above, really reflective.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader - Bear

customer_reviews.title: Good for reflective purposes
customer_reviews.text: I do like the collar and it is good for reflective purposes. I just have a problem with my cat removing the collar. She knows how to pull it off. She is strong. However, I did glue the connective part and she has not removed the collar to date. I know that the snap is for protective purposes but without gluing it, she would keep taking it off. I have tried other collars and she does the same. So, I wouldn't say that this company is the only one that does that. So, overall, this is a good collar.
customer_reviews.author: Bebe

customer_reviews.title: Break easily- clasp and reflective material
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 indoor/outdoor cats so I was excited to find a multi-pack of collars. Within 2 or so days, one of the collars kept falling off. After putting it back on a couple times, I ended up pitching it and taking another from the pack. As for the collar our other cat wore, the reflective material starting peeling off within a week. I wanted to love these but they’re cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S.

customer_reviews.title: They work. Kitty face clasp could go though.
customer_reviews.text: These collars are great for the price. They’re sturdy and durable. We like that they have the reflective material. However, the clasp is a kitty face which has two little ears that poke up. They are somewhat sharp. Some sharper than others. I have filed them down and made them dull so they don’t poke our kitties throats and necks. So they work but maybe different clasps would be better.
customer_reviews.author: TeniseRae J.

customer_reviews.title: Furublous find
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these collars for my father and sons trio who look alike to be able to determine which is which at a glance. The collars arrived quickly, the colors are vibrant and they quickly adjusted to their different sized necks. While it has only been a few days since they have adored their new jewelry, they haven't lost these collars and appear they will hold up to these frisky rough and tumble indoor outdoor fur babies.
customer_reviews.author: Cyn Day

customer_reviews.title: Reflection allows you to locate cats during evil kitty mode
customer_reviews.text: All 3 of my cats (5 months, 10 months & 3 years) have managed to remove these collars pretty quickly compared to ones I have bought in the past. I do like the bright colors, makes it easier to find them when they’re off and the reflective part has helped me avoid being murdered by the kittens due to their anger over seeing their reflection in their food bowls despite the bowls having food in them. So far there is no scratching destruction to the fabric. Overall not bad for the price - is rather buy a whole bag of collars at this price than one.
customer_reviews.author: L.Pelick

customer_reviews.title: Good value for cats who like collars
customer_reviews.text: Price is great. Super cute and fit great on our 3 kittens. But 1 cat is able to pull the clasp apart with hours of me putting it on him and one of cats helped chew one off the other cat within the first 24 hours as well. If you have a cat that doesn’t mind wearing a collar, these will be great, but if you are looking for a collar for a cat who is constantly trying to get it off, these are not the right pick. My search continues...
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Good intention, nice quality fabric and the reflective stripe ...
customer_reviews.text: Meh. I appreciate that it's reflective and that it is a breakaway collar. However, there needs to be more tension for the release. A breakaway collar is to prevent life threatening tension on the collar that could be choking the cat. My cat can undo this with so little effort. Good intention, nice quality fabric and the reflective stripe is really bright. However, just needs tweaking to be a suitable collar for kittens getting used to wearing one.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah LeeTop Contributor: Korean Beauty Products

customer_reviews.title: Great for your outdoor-indoor cat
customer_reviews.text: These reflective, break-away collars are great especially if your cat is an indoor/outdoor. Our little cat occasionally goes outside and sometimes comes home without her collar. It's great to have a replacement. She never goes out at night, but if that should accidentally happen, I'm glad that the collar is reflective. Price is right and made well.
customer_reviews.author: PhR

customer_reviews.title: Great price for 3 but my cat found a hack!
customer_reviews.text: I would love to save some $$$ on these damn cats lol but my little Aurora found a way to take it off. She took off 1 and lost the other one. But my other cat, Mochi, still has his attached. I do want something that’s safe for them and light but maybe I’ll try something different. 3 stars for price, delivery, features (Bell to hear your pet, quite loud). Maybe not the most reliable for those who want to break away from it!
customer_reviews.author: Eli Escobar

customer_reviews.title: These are Awesome Reflective Cat Collars...So Say Our Cats
customer_reviews.text: Along with their new pet tags, our cats are strutting around happily and proudly with their new collars. While we were putting one on the first cat, one of our orange cats decided he wanted in on the action as well. He couldn't wait to get his new collar and tag. Now 2 out of 3 cats (the third can be like Freddy Kruger when trying to wrangle him) are wearing these collars. They work so well and look very stylish. Honestly, our two cats love them. Thanks so much.
customer_reviews.author: SSG

customer_reviews.title: Great collars for a great price
customer_reviews.text: My cat goes through collars like nobody's business. The last 2 he managed to "lose" within an hour. At $8-9 a pop, this had gotten really expensive! Someone have me a link to these so I ordered immediately. The colors are a little brighter than I'd like, but they sell to be there same as the ones I get at the pet store. We just put the first one on him, so far he's had it on for 36 hours, do I consider that a success! Even if he loses them, I went feel so bad about it! The price is amazing! I wish I could give them 10 starts for value!
customer_reviews.author: Marion

customer_reviews.title: Nice deal...at the time
customer_reviews.text: These were only 5.94 when I bought them a couple a couple months ago. At a dollar per collar, it's worth the five stars for as fast as my guy loses them. I wouldn't spend what they're asking for them now. But they work fine for a while. I agree, the sharp plastic clasp is dumb but it doesn't bother my giant hairball. For me, this was a good purchase. I guess it depends on your cat.
customer_reviews.author: Pipes

customer_reviews.title: Go for it!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my 5 indoor cats to put name tags on them in case they ever were to get out. Any other collars from Walmart they would somehow get off hours later. It’s been 4 days and every cat still has their collar on! I can see where one is fraying a little, but she is my wildest one and I’m not surprised honestly. But it’s still on! I’m surprised. So I’m sold! I mean you get 6 for super cheap...worth it in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffani Madden

customer_reviews.title: Bell came off but collar stayed on.
customer_reviews.text: These collars seem to be as durable as one might expect, easy to fit to size and put on. The only problem, and it’s a big one, is that I found both the small bell and a larger one I had threaded onto the jump ring, both on the ground yet the collar was still on the cat. She apparently was caught on something that ripped the bells off without the breakaway catch disengaging. I’ve been reluctant to put another one on her for this very reason.
customer_reviews.author: Ronna Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Cat Collar with Bell
customer_reviews.text: I went to purchase a color at pet smart or one of those pet places and they suggested I take a particular one, when I got home it did not fit. I was so frustrated. I thought I would take a chance on this company. The Collars are cute, and it fit immediately, no adjustment. They care cute colors and I can switch them up with my cat. Really impressed, light weight, reflective and easy to use. I thought my cat would hate it, but it doesn't bother her in the least! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: health nut

customer_reviews.title: They do wear out.
customer_reviews.text: These work as advertised, but its good you get several as the plastic release clip weakens after a while so that the clip comes undone with almost no resistance. You can bend the plastic pieces out a bit to make fit better for a while, but eventually you have to replace. The yellow is VERY reflective, wish I could buy a package of just that color.
customer_reviews.author: Midmofan

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to receive 8 in the package. I have two cats and they can escape from most break-away collars. These are very sturdy but still have the safety release that cats require. I would definitely Recommend these collars. As a bonus, they have reflection tape on them. My cats, Mattie and Purrfect have lost all 8 of the collars I our got from you!! I love the Reflection collars and will order again. Do you have any suggestions about how to keep my 1 year old kittens from losing the breakaway collars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

product_meta.title: Upgraded Version - Reflective Cat Collar with Bell, Set of 6, Solid & Safe Collars for Cats, Nylon, Kitty Collars, Pet Collar, Breakaway Cat Collar, Free Replacement (6-Pack)
feature_bullets: NEW & IMPROVED 6-PACK - Our cat collar set contains 6 high quality cat collars of different colors (red, blue, orange, green, purple, pink)
HIGH QUALITY KITTY COLLARS - Our reflective cat / dog collar is solid, made of nylon. Comes with bells.
WORKS ON MANY PETS - Great collars for cats and small dogs and other small pets as well.
ADJUSTABLE SIZE - The size of the Breakaway Cat Collars is 7-11" (adjustable range)
LIFETIME WARRANTY CARD or FREE REPLACEMENT - If you are not satisfied with our cat collars we will give you a refund or send you a free replacement.

specifications.Color: Red, blue, orange, green, purple, pink
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars4,678 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
